intro: Anthenantia villosa var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy anthenantia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and stems, which contribute to its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native environment.
